hanze.PIV1E.leertaak2.actor

Class Bear

  • java.lang.Object
    • hanze.PIV1E.leertaak2.actor.Animal
      • hanze.PIV1E.leertaak2.actor.Bear
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Actor

    public class Bear
extends Animal
    A simple model of a bear. Bears age, move, eat foxes and rabbits and die.
    Version:
    01/02/2015
    Author:
    Tsjeard de Winter en Rick van der Poel

    • Constructor Detail

      • Bear

        public Bear(boolean randomAge,
            Field field,
            Location location,
            AbstractModel model)
        Create a bear. A bear can be created as a new born (age zero and not hungry) or with a random age and food level.
        Parameters:
        randomAge - If true, the bear will have random age and hunger level.
        field - The field currently occupied.
        location - The location within the field.

    • Method Detail

      • act

        public void act()
        This is what the bear does most of the time: it hunts for rabbits and foxes. In the process, it might breed, die of hunger, or die of old age.
        Parameters:
        field - The field currently occupied.
        newBears - A list to return newly born foxes.

        age of the bear

        Set the Bear to infected
        Parameters:
        infect - true to make this Bear sick
